meanings.definition: Capable of being given as a reward or recognition.
meanings.sent1: The student's hard work was awardable, so the teacher gave them a gold star.
meanings.sent2: The trophy was shiny and awardable, making it a perfect prize for the winner.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's adorable antics were so awardable that it received a treat as a reward.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity were awardable qualities that shone brightly in her character.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking sunset painted the sky with awardable colors, deserving admiration.

meanings.sent1: His exceptional performance in the play was awardable, earning him the title of best actor.
meanings.sent2: The brave firefighter's actions were truly awardable, recognized by the entire community.
meanings.sent3: The cat's impressive ability to catch mice made it awardable of a special treat.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication and hard work were awardable, leading to her success in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's groundbreaking discovery was awardable of a prestigious prize.

meanings.sent1: The top athletes were awardable candidates for the championship trophy.
meanings.sent2: The outstanding students were awardable of scholarships for their academic achievements.
meanings.sent3: The talented artist was awardable of recognition for their beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent4: The exceptional volunteers were awardable of a special thank-you ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The dedicated employee was awardable of the Employee of the Month title.
